wikitext.*:
{{disambig-more|The Lord of the Rings|[[The Lord of the Rings (disambiguation)]]}} {{book |title=The Lord of the Rings Tarot | image = The Lord of the Rings Tarot.jpg |author=Terry Donaldson |publisher=U.S. Games |date=[[1 September]] [[1997]] |format=Softcover |pages=224 |isbn=1572810548 }} '''''The Lord of the Rings Tarot''''' is a book describing a [[:Wikipedia:Tarot|Tarot deck]] and a card game based on ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' and ''[[The Hobbit]]''. The book is accompanied by the own pack of cards called '''''The Lord of the Rings Tarot Deck & Card Game'''''. ==Synopsis of the publisher== {{blockquote|The Lord of the Rings Tarot unites two great traditions: the spiritual, mystical tradition of the tarot, and the world of folklore and fairy tales that is most delightfully depicted in the works of J.R.R. Tolkien. The added factor of a card game summons you to travel through Middle-earth to reach Mount Doom and destroy the One Ring!

Fanciful characters and scenes from J.R.R. Tolkien's 'The Lord of the Rings' trilogy and 'The Hobbit' appear on each of the 22 Major Arcana and 56 Minor Arcana cards. Rules are included for a card game for 2-6 players, ages 10 to adult.}} ==Card Game== The instructions included with the tarot cards also contains a set of rules for a competitive card game. Each tarot card bears a symbol that shows it is aligned with one of the factions: "Free Peoples" (FP, 51 cards), "Dark Forces" (DF, 20 cards), "Neutral" (N, six cards) or "The One Ring" (OR, one card). Players earn victory points by playing all of their cards, being the ring-bearer (The Wheel of Fortune) and having the most and/or least Dark Points at the end of the round, three of which are played (mimicking the three volumes of the book). ==Major Arcana== * 0 - ''The Fool'': [[Gollum]] (N) * I - ''The Magician'': [[Gandalf]] (FP) * II - ''The High Priestess'': [[Éowyn]] (FP) * III - ''The Empress'': [[Galadriel]] with [[Belladonna Took]] and [[Rose Cotton]] (FP) * IV - ''The Emperor'': [[Celeborn]] refuses The One Ring (FP) * V - ''The Hierophant'': [[Saruman]] claims the [[Palantír]] (DF) * VI - ''The Lovers'': [[Aragorn]] and [[Arwen]] (FP) * VII - ''The Chariot'': [[Théoden]] in battle (FP) * VIII - ''Strength'': [[White Tree of Gondor]] (FP) * IX - ''The Hermit'': [[Tom Bombadil]] (FP) * X - ''Wheel of Fortune'': [[The One Ring]] (OR) * XI - ''Justice'': [[Oathbreakers]] (FP) * XII - ''The Hanged Man'': [[Faramir]] about to die (FP) * XIII - ''Death'': Gandalf dies against [[Durin's Bane]] (FP) * XIV - ''Temperance'': [[Frodo]] forgives Gollum's life (FP) * XV - ''The Devil'': [[Gríma]] (DF) * XVI - ''The Tower'': [[Orthanc]] under [[Battle of Isengard|attacked]] (DF) * XVII - ''The Star'': [[Phial of Galadriel]] (FP) * XVIII - ''The Moon'': [[Minas Morgul]]'s power increases (DF) * XIX - ''The Sun'': The [[Sun]] shines over [[The Shire]] (FP) * XX - ''Judgement'': Gandalf reveals Frodo the nature of the One Ring (FP) * XXI - ''The World'': [[Middle-earth]] and [[Aman]] (N) ==Minor Arcana== ===Coins=== * ''Ace of Coins'': Celeborn on his throne (FP) * ''Two of Coins'': The [[Ents]] (FP) * ''Three of Coins'': [[Bilbo]] reading in his library (FP) * ''Four of Coins'': The Great Tree of [[Lórien]] (FP) * ''Five of Coins'': The [[Fellowship of the Ring]] in [[Moria]] (N) * ''Six of Coins'': Bilbo finds treasure in [[Smaug]]'s lair (N) * ''Seven of Coins'': The Fellowship is turned away by [[Caradhras]] (N) * ''Eight of Coins'': The [[Houses of Healing]] tend to Faramir's wounds (FP) * ''Nine of Coins'': The [[Nine Rings]] (DF) * ''Ten of Coins'': Smaug in The [[Misty Mountains]] (DF) * ''Page of Coins'': [[Glorfindel]] meets the [[Ring-bearer]] in [[Rivendell]] (FP) * ''Knight of Coins'': Soldier of [[Gondor]] (FP) * ''Queen of Coins'': [[Lúthien]] weeps for [[Beren]] (FP) * ''King of Coins'': [[Treebeard]] (DF) ===Cups=== * ''Ace of Cups'': [[Galadriel's Mirror]] (FP) * ''Two of Cups'': Faramir and Éowyn embrace (FP) * ''Three of Cups'': Frodo reunites with Bilbo in Rivendell (FP) * ''Four of Cups'': Frodo, [[Sam]], [[Pippin]] and [[Merry]] befriend [[Farmer Maggot]] (FP) * ''Five of Cups'': The Fellowship grieves the fall of Gandalf (FP) * ''Six of Cups'': Pippin and Merry relax after the fall of Orthanc (FP) * ''Seven of Cups'': The [[Palantíri]] (DF) * ''Eight of Cups'': Gollum leads Frodo and Sam through the [[Dead Marshes]] (DF) * ''Nine of Cups'': [[Bilbo's Farewell Party]]
